page.title: 12MAY DAY
page.content: At the school we always celebrate the 1st. of May. We elect a May Queen and King and at 6 o'clock on a suitable evening they process through the village in a goat-cart, followed by all the school-children. When they reach the village green the King and Queen are crowned and then the children dance around the Maypole. Usually Kirtlington Morris Men join us and do some demonstration dances. This is a custom which has been observed for many years. The Maypole dances done are: Spider's Web Gipsy's Tent Barber's Pole Single Plait Double Plait
